findings.rationale: Limiting liability to the total contract value may expose a party to significant risk if damages exceed this amount, especially in cases of negligence or misconduct.
findings.evidence_quote: Each party's liability is limited to the total contract value, except for indemnification obligations.

findings.rationale: The ability to terminate the agreement for convenience with only 45 days notice may lead to sudden disruptions and financial unpredictability for either party.
findings.evidence_quote: Either party may terminate for convenience with 45 days written notice.

findings.rationale: Capping indemnification obligations at the annual contract value may leave parties underprotected against significant claims arising from negligence or misconduct.
findings.evidence_quote: Each party shall indemnify the other for claims arising from its own gross negligence or willful misconduct, capped at annual contract value.

findings.rationale: The warranty only covers performance per the Statement of Work, which may limit recourse for issues outside its scope.
findings.evidence_quote: Provider warrants that services will be performed in accordance with the Statement of Work.
